comment.body:
Welcome to Zeronet! Seems like you already know your way around pretty well.

The [ZeroTalk forums](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit) are a nice place to get information if you need.

Keep peering!

Nice!

So far all I had on it was the good ol' option of `:X` for symmetric encryption. This seems safer. 

Thanks for sharing!

Good choice, vim is an excellent text editor. I don't want to fuel editor-wars here, of course, but it works for me so well that I can't really see myself using anything else anymore these days.

Small and *portable*, I carry it pretty much everywhere to avoid having to use some other editor. What other application could embrace the hacker's spirit so well as vim?
I should try this someday. Perhaps that way I will finally get off my ass and properly learn regular expressions myself :P

Ah, so that's how it works! Thanks for the simple explanation.

It sucks for me that Debian Jessie still has Tor version 0.2.5 in its repos, so I guess it will take me a while until I actually get to use it :(

Awesome! I should try doing this with my home server too. I've gotten pretty lazy with self-hosting ever since I got done with XMPP, so this could be an interesting exercise to get back on my feet.

BTW I see everyone in the internet indicating Nginx for web servers today. Is it really that lightweight? I've been using `lighttpd` so far, but would try it out if it was better.

Thank you for an awesome post, man!
